title: Tottenham news: Harry Redknapp predicts where Spurs will finish this season
text:
Mauricio Pochettino has had a bad start to the season with Spurs (Picture: Getty Images)

Harry Redknapp has backed Totttenham to come good after a shaky start and finish third in the Premier League this season.

Spurs have won just three of their opening eight league fixtures and sit ninth in the table after their shock 3-0 defeat to Brighton last time out.

That loss to the Seagulls came off the back of the 7-2 thrashing at the hands of Bayern Munich in the Champions League, making it a very difficult time for manager Mauricio Pochettino.

However, Redknapp believes Tottenham have a squad comparable to Premier League champions Manchester City and Champions League winners Liverpool, and expects them to come good over the campaign.

‘At the start of the year I really thought Spurs would push Man City and Liverpool a lot, lot closer,’ told Sportsmail. ‘Tottenham have got a great team, with Harry Kane, Dele Alli, Son – I thought this could be their year.

Harry Redknapp managed Tottenham from 2008-2012 (Picture: AMA/Getty Images)

‘But it’s been a disappointing start for them for sure and they need to turn it around quickly, but I still think they’ll finish third.

‘They’ve got the best stadium in the country, the best training ground. It’s all in place. They’ve got a great group of players. It’s some squad, if you go through it, I don’t care what anybody says I don’t think there’s a lot between that squad and Liverpool’s and Man City’s squad, I really don’t.

‘You’re as good as your players. Graham Taylor once said “your manager is never as good as you think he is and he’s never as bad as you think he is, he’s somewhere in between” and that is football management.

‘If you put Pochettino, or you put Pep [Guardiola] or [Jurgen] Klopp and let them go and manage Brighton or manage Norwich or Sheffield United, they’re not gonna go and put them in the top six, it doesn’t work that way.

‘It’s about the players. He [Pochettino] has got the good players but at the moment there’s been hiccups – one of two of them are not playing to their real potential or as good as they can.’

Spurs are back in action at home to Watford on Saturday in a match Pochettino desperately needs to win to halt their recent slide in form.

The Hornets are bottom of the table and the only side in the division without a league win so far this season, if they were to get a result in north London then pressure would be heaped on Pochettino.
